member.summary: Quaternion Number

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Scalar
member.summary: Returns a new Quaternion q with the Scalar part only. If you need a Double, use the Real-Field instead.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Vector
member.summary: Returns a new Quaternion q with the Vector part only.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.UnitVector
member.summary: Returns a new normalized Quaternion u with the Vector part only, such that ||u|| = 1. Q may then be represented as q = r*(cos(phi) + u * sin(phi)) = r*exp(phi*u) where r is the absolute and phi the argument of q.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Sign
member.summary: Returns a new normalized Quaternion q with the direction of this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.op_UnaryPlus(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: (nop)

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.op_UnaryNegation(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: Negate a quaternion.

member.summary: Add a quaternion to a quaternion.

member.summary: Add a floating point number to a quaternion.

member.summary: Subtract a quaternion from a quaternion.

member.summary: Multiply a quaternion with a quaternion.

member.summary: Multiply a floating point number with a quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.op_Division(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion,MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: Divide a quaternion by a quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.op_Division(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion,System.Double)
member.summary: Divide a quaternion by a floating point number.

member.summary: Raise a quaternion to a quaternion.

member.summary: Convert a floating point number to a quaternion.

member.summary: Add a quaternion to this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Add(System.Double)
member.summary: Add a floating point number to this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Subtract(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: Subtract a quaternion from this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Subtract(System.Double)
member.summary: Subtract a floating point number from this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Negate
member.summary: Negate this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Multiply(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: Multiply a quaternion with this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Multiply(System.Double)
member.summary: Multiply a floating point number to this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Divide(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: Multiplies a Quaternion with the inverse of another Quaternion (q*q-1). Note that for Quaternions q*q-1 is not the same then q-1*q, because this will lead to a rotation in the other direction.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Divide(System.Double)
member.summary: Multiplies a Quaternion with the inverse of a real number.
member.remarks: Its also possible to cast a double to a Quaternion and make the division afterward, but that would be more expensive.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Inverse
member.summary: Inverts this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Distance(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion,MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: Returns the distance |a-b| of two quaternions, forming a metric space.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Conjugate
member.summary: Conjugate this quaternion.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Log(System.Double)
member.summary: Logarithm to a given base.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Ln
member.summary: Natural Logarithm to base E.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Lg
member.summary: Common Logarithm to base 10.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Exp
member.summary: Exponential Function.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Pow(System.Double)
member.summary: Raise the quaternion to a given power.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Pow(MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion)
member.summary: Raise the quaternion to a given power.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Sqr
member.summary: Square of the Quaternion q: q^2.

member.name: M:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Sqrt
member.summary: Square root of the Quaternion: q^(1/2).

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Real
member.summary: Gets the real part of the quaternion.

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.ImagX
member.summary: Gets the imaginary X part (coefficient of complex I) of the quaternion.

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.ImagY
member.summary: Gets the imaginary Y part (coefficient of complex J) of the quaternion.

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.ImagZ
member.summary: Gets the imaginary Z part (coefficient of complex K) of the quaternion.

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Abs
member.summary: Gets the standard euclidean length |q| = sqrt(||q||) of the quaternion q: the square root of the sum of the squares of the four components. Q may then be represented as q = r*(cos(phi) + u * sin(phi)) = r*exp(phi*u) where u is the unit vector and phi the argument of q.

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Norm
member.summary: Gets the norm ||q|| = |q|^2 of the quaternion q: the sum of the squares of the four components.

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.Arg
member.summary: Gets the argument phi = arg(q) of the quaternion q, such that q = r*(cos(phi) + u * sin(phi)) = r*exp(phi*u) where r is the absolute and u the unit vector of q.

member.name: P:MathNet.Spatial.Quaternion.IsUnitQuaternion
member.summary: True if the quaternion q is of length |q| = 1.
member.remarks: To normalize a quaternion to a length of 1, use the method. All unit quaternions form a 3-sphere.
